The Finance Minister also assured to take necessary action in this direction.

Taneja said that the Chamber also demanded that unless the position of land is given to the entrepreneurs in the industrial area after the allotment of land, pressure should not be made on the entrepreneurs to deposit the amount. Similarly, extension for the next six months should be given to the installation of entrepreneurs for land allocation, he added.

During the meeting, Chamber President Kunal Ajmani apprised the traders and entrepreneurs of the cause of the lockdown and sought permission to open the industrial units of the state as directed by the Ministry of Home Affairs.

On the spot, the Finance Minister held a telephonic conversation with the Chief Secretary, on which he informed that as per the instructions of the Ministry of Home Affairs, correspondence has been issued to all the District Deputy Commissioners.

Title: Admin ensures supply of food grains at Hindpiri
Article:
The Ranchi district administration has taken various initiatives to check the spread of Coronavirus. The administration in this connection has constituted various cells. On Thursday a meeting of nodal officers of various cells was held at control room located at Gurunanak School. In the meeting Deputy Development commissioner Ananya Mittal issued the several directions to nodal officers. Magistrates who have been appointed to monitor the situation were asked to visit control rooms at regular intervals and submit the daily report.

Health workers and officials are deputed at Hindpiri area -- the epicenter of Coronavirus pandemic ensuring medical facilities. The Civil Surgeon has been assigned the job to ensure that pregnant women in the Hindpiri area get better health facilities. The Civil Surgeon office has decided to engage the services of Aanganwadi Sewika and Sahiya Workers in this connection.

For the supply of ration and other essential items ADM (Naxal) has been made the nodal office. His work is to ensure that there is adequate supply of foodgrains to PDS dealers. Lead bank manager has been made as nodal officer for functional of mobile ATMs. District co-operative officials have been given the task to ensure regular supply of vegetables in the area. The district administration through vans is making supply of milk, vegetables at different parts of locality.

The district administration is also making door to door delivery of foodgrains to red and yellow ration card holders.

The district administration has made godown at Gurunanak School and FCI has even dump grains in the area moreover such people who don't have ration card the administration is identifying such people and providing ration to them.

Hindpiri -- The hotspot of COVID --19 pandemic has been sealed for past one week. An elderly man has died and around fourteen persons have been tested positive. As the area has been sealed people's movement have been restricted. Police officials are carrying out flag march in the area at regular intervals. Cops have been deployed in the entry and exit point of the area. The area is also monitored through drone cameras. The district administration is also identifying such people, who are breaking the lockdown. Meanwhile, Ranchi DC Rai Mahimapat Ray has issued directions for enforcing lockdown strictly. The DC has said that strict actions will be taken against those, who break lockdown without any valid reason. The DC has also asked people to remain in house and follow lockdown seriously.

Title: Light showers expected across State till April 20
Article:
For the next few days the residents of Jharkhand will have some respite from the rising temperatures as light to moderate showers are being predicted across the State till April 20.

As per the Meteorological Centre, Ranchi light to moderate showers are expected across the State from April 17 to April 20. From April 21 onwards Jharkhand is likely to have dry weather condition.

On April 17 light to moderate spells of rainfall accompanied with thunder storm and lighting are expected in isolated places of north- east and south- east parts of Jharkhand. Central and western parts will witness light showers on April 18 where as isolated places in central, north eastern and south eastern parts are likely to receive showers and thunderstorms on April 19. Isolated places in the northern and central parts of the State are also expected to receive light showers with thunderstorm and lighting on April 20.

The weathermen have also issued a warning of gusty winds at a speed of about 30- 40 Km per hour at isolated places in the central, western and northern parts of Jharkhand for April 18 and April 20.

“For Jharkhand to receive light to moderate showers in April is a very normal phenomenon. With rising temperatures local clouds also form and if there is any moisture feeding circulation nearby, it usually results in a light shower in the region,” said Deputy Director, MET Centre Ranchi, Abhishek Anand.

As per the MET Centre Ranchi, for the next few days not many changes in the maximum temperatures levels are expected and it will remain near normal. As per the weather bulletin released on April 16, the maximum highest temperature was recorded in Daltonganj at 40 degree Celsius. Jamshedpur and Chaibasa were recorded at 39 and 39.8 degree Celsius respectively.

“The State capital was recorded at 37.6 degree Celsius and it is likely to remain below 40 degrees in the coming days as well. The temperature recorded in Ranchi is around near normal for this time of the year,” added the official.

As per the communiqué issued, from April 17 to April 20 the maximum temperature in Ranchi and its surrounding areas is likely to remain around 37 to 39 degree Celsius.

Title: Team to supply essentials in hotspots
Article:
To maintain uninterrupted supply of essential commodities to the people within containment zones, the Delhi Government has set up a team of nodal officers for food, ration, medical supplies etc. and has distributed their numbers to all the residents.

For this, a local point within the each containment area has been identified where every morning, supplies will be provided to residents.

After the success of operation shield in Dilshad Garden and few other areas, the Government has implemented this idea in other containment zones too.

The Delhi Government officials said Gali number -4, Kishan Kunj Extension, East Delhi, is one such area where a person was found Covid-19 positive after his death. “Later 6 of his family members were also found positive. The Delhi Government immediately sealed the whole area, declared it as a containment zone and initiated operation shield.”

“The Delhi Government officials who are responsible to look after this area have formed a WhatsApp group of all the residents where they can put out their requests and the Government is ensuring a speedy delivery of the same,” said a official.

Elaborating further, the official said Government officials have also provided the contact numbers of the officials, relief centres, hunger relief centre and of other essential people or places. If the residents of this area are unable to reach out to these contact points then they visit the local officer-in-charge of the area and the concerned team immediately take care of the demands.

"The Delhi Government is ensuring all the essential services to the people who are staying inside this containment zone. In this area, none of the residents is allowed to go outside but they can come till a point where the officials stay available 24×7. We have formed a WhatsApp group and all the residents of this area are being added in that group. We have provided all the important numbers of officials and the essential service providers. The residents put their demands in that WhatsApp group and we immediately ensure the services. In case if they are unable to reach out to us over the WhatsApp then they come and meet the designated officials at the border of this area. We take note of the demands and immediately arrange the services from the local suppliers. After arranging the essential commodities forced we sanitise and disinfect the person concerned and then handover the essential goods," said Mr Mohit Dhama, Nodal officer for the Gali number -4, Kishan Kunj Extension.

Talking about this containment area, Yogesh Pratap Singh, Additional District Magistrate, East Delhi said, "Sanjeev Gupta a person who was suffering from kidney problem returned after dialysis and died. After his death, the Delhi Government conducted Covid-19 test and it was found positive. Thereafter 6 of his family members were also found positive and were admitted for treatment.

The Delhi Government immediately declared this area as a containment zone and sealed this whole area. The Delhi Government has also conducted tests of 11 of the neighbours who came in touch with this family as a precautionary measure. Due to the immediate action, there are no new cases from this area. The reports of the 11 people are awaiting."

It may be noted that government on Wednesday extended the list of containment zones to include two more areas, taking the total number of areas in the list to 57.

No residents, excluding essential workers, are allowed to enter or exit these areas. Meanwhile, health care workers will conduct door-to-door screening of the area's residents for Covid-19.

Delhi Government has launched ‘Operation Shield’ in all the hotspot areas to combat and control the spread of COVID-19 virus. Delhi Chief Minister Mr Arvind Kejriwal made the announcement on April 9, 2020. Operation Shield is an operation that has been launched to trace and identify positive coronavirus cases and to eliminate the risk of community transmission. The operation mainly involves sealing of hotspot areas, identifying and quarantining suspected cases or contact cases, ensuring doorstep delivery of essential services and door-to-door checking of people to check for asymptomatic cases or those with mild symptoms.

''Operation SHIELD'' has completely stopped the transmission of coronavirus in Dilshad Garden with no new cases reported in the last 16 days. A total of 123 medical teams screened more than 15,000 people living in 4,032 houses and hospitalised the coronavirus suspects in this area. The Delhi Government had earlier on April 7, 2020 launched 5Ts to tackle Covid-19 spread in the National Capital, which includes- Testing, Tracing, Treatment, Teamwork and Tracking and Monitoring.

Meanwhile, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal also assured that the Capital will boost its testing capacity and undertake aggressive testing to identify, trace, quarantine and treat positive Covid-19 cases.

Title: Govt provides grains to 3L people with no ration cards
Article:
The Food and Supply Department of the Delhi Government has provided grains to over 3 lakh poor who had no ration cards to help them tide over the lockdown.

The department of food and supplies is making all out efforts towards meeting the food requirements of the poor and vulnerable sections of the city. The department, in a statement, said that the distribution was started on April 7. Besides, steps were also taken to provide ration to the PDS (public distribution system) cardholders.

In Delhi, the Public Distribution System (PDS) caters to 17.50 lakh households covering 71,08,074 beneficiaries including 68,609 Antyodaya Anna Yojana (AAY) households with 2,78,926 beneficiaries. The usual monthly quota of food grains under ‘National Food Security Act’ (NFSA) is 5 kg including 4 kg of wheat and 1 kg of rice, it said.

However, recognising the need of the hour and the restrictions in mobility of people due to imposition of lockdown, the Delhi Government has provided 7.5 kgs of food grains (including 6 kgs of wheat and 1.5 kgs of rice) free of cost, it added.

The department further said that the distribution of food grains for the month of April started in advance from 28th March, 2020 onwards through network of 2017 Fair Price Shops.

“Almost 100 per cent of the entitled allocation has been delivered most of which has been distributed. This has provided much needed relief to the people particularly those from the disadvantaged and vulnerable sections,” it said.

It further said that after realising that there may be a significant number of people who may be in need of food during these difficult times and who may not be covered by the PDS, the government launched a relief initiative for providing 4 kgs of wheat and 1kg of rice to all those who are in need of food free of cost.

“The initiative is based on self selection criteria where any person in need of food can apply through an online link of Janta Samvad - ration.jantasamvad.org/ration,” it said, adding that the only document required is that the person should be in possession of an aadhaar number issued from anywhere in the country.

In order to optimally utilise available resources, 374 schools of Directorate of Education, municipal Corporations and New Delhi Municipal Council have been designated as Distribution centers under the above relief initiative. T

he programme was launched on the 7th of April and till date over 3 lakh beneficiaries have been provided food grains.

To inform and educate the targeted beneficiaries regarding their entitlements multimedia publicity through SMS, Radio Jingle, flex banners etc. is being undertaken on a regular basis.

The department is making all out efforts to ensure the smooth and timely delivery and distribution of food grains to the beneficiaries despite severe shortages of labour and availability of trucks and other logistics constrains due to the ongoing lockdown.

“Civil defence volunteers have been deployed at the Fair Price Shops to ensure social distancing norms and orderly distribution of food grains,” it said, adding that the departmental officials including assistant commissioners, food supply officers and food supply inspectors have also been deployed in the field round the clock to facilitate the distribution of food grains.

“All Department Officials and the distribution team of fair price shops and schools are working seven days a week without any weekly off. The Members of vigilance committee are actively monitoring the distribution process. The Deputy Chief Minister, Minister Food and Supplies and the area MLAs are inspecting the distribution centres to motivate the staff and to ensure smooth distribution,” it added.

Title: NE Delhi riot victims feeding daily wagers
Article:
nA group of people in riot-hit North-east Delhi has come to the rescue of daily wagers, poor and destitutes of the areas by supplying cooked food and dry rations to them.

Residents of these areas have also joined hands in the distribution of food among stranded labourers and locals who are solely dependent on daily earnings to survive.

Virendra Kumar (40), a resident of Gali number 5 of Moonga Nagar which is located at Karawal Nagar road in North-east Delhi, said that he started distributing cooked food soon after the nationwide lockdown was announced in the wake of life-threatening coronavirus pandemic.

Kumar is one of the victims of communal riots witnessed in North-east Delhi in the last week of February. Recalling the ‘horror’ caused by communal clashes, Kumar said a “Muslim mob” of 200 people forcibly entered his building during riots and started pelting stones from my balcony. “How can I deny food to a hungry? Sometimes, there are children aged 5 to 10 year from a particular community standing in queue waiting for their turn. I am giving food to everyone who needed it at this time,” he said. “Feeding the poor and hungry is a noble cause. Thousands of people have benefitted with this initiative till now. It is a continuous process. We will keep reaching to those in need of food at this time,” he added.

Vijay Kashyap, a resident of gali number 20 in Shiv Vihar phase 7, suffered a huge financial loss during riots as a mob entered into his house and destroyed everything came in sight. “I first started helping widows and migrants labourer in the areas with food packet and milk with the help of Sewa Nyaya Utthan, a registered Non Governmental Organization (NGO). We have widened and reaching out to more people to help them to tide over the crisis,” he said.

“We all were very frightened as my father was not at home when the riots had started, my little sister got scared and started crying. It was all very difficult to forget what happened when us but now even my father and family members are helping me in distributing food even for Muslim families living around the area,’ he said.

Vandana Gupta, an ASHA worker has been distributing food items to identified families in gali number 14 of Shiv Vihar.

“I always ensure that food should be distributed to needy one. I survey the area door to door and distribute it only after then. There are many daily-wagers in the areas whose livelihood is lost due to lockdown as well as those who lost their means of earning in the riots. We are providing relief to everyone,” she said. .

Title: 5 booked for spreading hate messages in Palamu
Article:
Five youths were pushed behind the bars for using and spreading hate among communities, animosity, notes hurting religious sentiments on social media portal.

SP Palamu Ajay Linda said, “Palamu police are very tough with all those elements who have refused to listen to sane advice of police not to write, spread hate messages that outrage sentiments of any community and deepens divide between the two communities.”

Linda said these five have been booked in a span of two weeks. Sources said none has raised any finger on the neutrality of police as its actions are against offenders of both the communities.

A facebook user said, “ Once a hate message comes in reaction of it is posted an equally damaging and hurtful message and then a trail starts of it without understanding the consequences of it.”

Linda said, “I have directed my all SDPOs , officers in charge, inspectors of police to be on guard against abuse of social media and take immediate actions against all those who indulge in verbal religious assault.”

Reminded that despite severe police action cases of abuse of social media fail to stop to which Linda said “ This shows the mind set of a very few people coming from both the communities who have this notion that writing obscene things about other’s religion will make them popular but the fact is law gets first on them.”

Sources said political pressure comes on police when action against abuser of social media platform is done. Linda however said, “Palamu police go by rule of law. We do not have time to listen to any such request in regard to either give someway leeway to offenders or to give them any more chance.”

SDPO Sadar Sandip Kumar Gupta said “ We had issued an appeal in which police had given a chance to abusers of social media platform to delete all such messages either written in the past or fresh ones without sharing it anymore.”

Gupta said despite such opportunity there are ‘facebook warriors’ ( a great satire) who do not refrain from indulging in spreading communal hatred against each other.

He said a warning not to spread hate has been miked too which has been heard by all but not followed by a miniscule section of people.

SDPO Bishrampur Surjit Kumar has also appealed to people to abstain from any such activity which weakens harmony and amity.

SP Linda said “ It is time for all of us to fight coronavirus but there are very few people who quite mindlessly are trying to vitiate communal atmosphere which will be curbed and contained with a very firm hands of law of the land.”

The SP further added there are youths who use fake ID and live in notion that police will not be able to track them down and for such people police want to tell them use your wisdom to fight coronavirus and not dare to spread communal virus.

Title: Lockdown violation: 20 booked, Rs 1.44 L fined
Article:
With the lockdown 2.0, residents of Bokaro were instructed to stay home and not to step out except for emergencies. Violators could land in even more trouble as the city police have decided to step up the action against those found wandering the streets, police said.

At least 20 people have been booked for violation of lockdown to curb the spread of Novel Coronavirus infection in Bokaro.

A fine of Rs 1.44 lakhs was recovered (as fine) for violation of lockdown from offenders, informed S Rajak DSP Traffic.

All total 80 bikes have been seized during past 24 hours out of which, 54 under Herla police station. Fine has been imposed to 37 peoples while, FIR was lodged against 17, informed OC of Herla police station.

Two bikes were also seized at Siwandih under Marafari police station for violation of lockdown.

Deputy Commissioner Bokaro Mukesh Kumar urged, people should follow lockdown and cooperate with the police.

“Unless you are a key worker or helping someone vulnerable, the only reasons to go outside are to go shopping for essentials, medical needs, exercise once a day, stressed DC.

“They should return home as soon as the purchase is done and not linger on roads,” he added.

“Police can now arrest anyone found outside without good reason,” he said.

Meanwhile, about 52 labourers who were rushed to Gamharia Village under Chandankiyari block from West Bengal were screened yesterday. After preliminary investigation, no symptoms of the coronavirus infection were found in any of them. From a health standpoint, everyone was sent to a quarantine center for 14 days, informed Kumari Vedwanti, Block Development Officer Chandankiyari.

Title: FIR against two minors on rape charges
Article:
Two minor girls were allegedly raped by the two minor boys in a village under Ketar police station around 70 km away from the district headquarter, on Wednesday, police said.

The minor girls, aged around 16, had gone to collect Mahua flower near the bank of Sone River in the morning, when two boys hailing from adjacent village forcibly molested and raped them. The victims informed to their families about the incident. The family members informed the police on Wednesday evening.

On the basis of victims’ statement Ketar police registered FIR under section 376 of IPC and 6 of the POCSO Act against both minor boys, said officer in Charge Jainath Oraon.

Title: Bokaro Admin launches Facebook Live to entertain mass during lockdown
Article:
Taking a unique initiative district administration Bokaro has launched Live Facebook programme titled “Tales of Happiness spreads positivity” on

Monday.During the period of lockdown, the district administration has made efforts to entertain people who remain in their home in an attempt to prevent the spread of Coronavirus infection, informed DPRO Rahul Kumar Bharti.

Under this programme, scholars and experts of various subjects and fields will be lived and share their experiences every day to spread positive message among the public through this Facebook Live, he informed.

Knowledge of Science, Panchatantra story, Nana – Nani, Dada - Dadi stories, motivational songs, music, and poetries would be broadcast live under this programme, he said.

This is an attempt to create an entertaining atmosphere among the common people, said the DPRO.

Today, Mahashweta, a teacher of DPS Bokaro made an effort to entertain mass with her poetry and ghazals on this Facebook Live programme.The DPRO presented a sanitizer made by the district administration as a welcome gift to Mahashweta on this eve.

Title: Gang of 7 bike-borne criminals open fire over Facebook comment
Article:
A gang of seven bike-borne criminals entered the house of a youth at Road No 6 in Ramnagar under Kadma police station area late on the Wednesday night opened fire.

The attackers, one of whom identified as Bittu Gwala, who was released from jail a month ago had fired two shots at the victim, Shivnath Kumar. The shots missed and hit the wall of the victim's house.

The police have registered a case of attempt to murder against Bittu Gwala, Sumit Kumar and five others on the FIR lodged by Shivnath. The police said that the dispute revolves around dispute over Facebook comment done by the victim.

OC, Kadma police station Ranjeet Kumar confirmed about the case, but said that all the seven persons went missing after launching attack.

"We are investigating the incident. Though all the attackers have fled the area, we are trying to arrest them by carrying out raids at the houses of the two named accused," said Kumar. The OC pointed out that for identifying the rest of the attackers they are trying to find out CCTV footage. He said a police team had visited the place where incident took place and by talking to the victims and people in the neighbourhood that the attackers had fired two shots. He pointed out they have even recovered an empty cartridge from the spot.

Kumar, when queried, said the reason behind the quarrel was a Facebook comment that the victim had posted involving the names of Bittu Gwala.

According to sources, Bittu Gwala has a criminal past and he has been released on bail from the Ghaghidih Central Jail a month ago.

According to a neighbour, the accused had come on four bikes near Shivnath's house had called him to come out of the home. As the victim came out, Bittu Gwala abused the former and subsequently fished out a pistol. As the victim came out and entered into the house at the sight of youths near his house, Bittu Gwala fired two shots in the wall of the house and fled the spot.

Title: BSL's CRM-3 gets auto-sanitisation facility
Article:
Special attention is being given to sanitisation to prevent corona infection. In view of this, the team of BSL's

CRM-3 department has created a complete automatic sanitisation device for the personnel, which is installed near the main entrance of the department. The facility was inaugurated by Atanu Bhowmik, Executive Director (Operations) of BSL. Every employee of CRM-3 will be able to avail the facility of automatic sanitization and sanitize themselves in the order of commuting. Chief General Manager of CRM-3, Rajan Prasad also called upon all the employees to take advantage of this facility and take all other necessary precautions.

This tool is built by the internal resources available by the team of CRM-3. Also Separate groups of BSL personnel are constantly striving to provide food or ration to the needy during lock down. In this episode, a team of Coke Owen Department personnel has also started distributing ration packets among the people.

This team started it by distributing ration packets among 200 residents of Nirmal Village near the railway station. Inspired by the SAIL "Service" scheme, this team of officers of Coke Owen Department will continue this campaign further.

Title: State mulls Rs 2,000 support to labourers stuck in lockdown
Article:
Finance Minister Dr. Rameshwar Oraon on Thursday said that the Government was pondering over paying Rs.2000 through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) to the Jharkhand labourers stuck in other states during the ongoing lockdown. The proposal will be submitted to Chief Minister Hemant Soren within the next 24 hours for approval, he added.

Talking to media persons in Ranchi after a meeting of the Cabinet Sub Committee on COVID-19, Oraon said that providing relief to migrant labourers of the State was one of the main agenda of the meeting. Ministers Champai Soren, Satyanand Bhokta and Banna Gupta attended the meeting along with Principal Secretaries of several important departments.

"We are compiling a data of Jharkhand's labourers stuck in other states. The various MPs and MLAs have been requested to help in creating this data," said Oraon, adding that Anganwadi workers and other government staff working at the grassroot level will also help in creating the data.

It was the duty of all the State governments to ensure food and accommodation for migrant labourers during this ongoing crisis, said Oraon. “We will establish a dialogue with chief ministers of other States for providing help to our labourers," he added.

The Minister said that that many states including Bihar and Odisha have also tried to provide financial assistance to migrant workers trapped outside. "A final call on our proposal of paying Rs.2000 to each of our migrant labourers stuck in other states will be taken soon," he added.

He informed that after the end of the lockdown, several lakh people will return to Jharkhand, and the Government may urge the railways to provide free tickets to such people. “Proper arrangements will be made for all their health check-ups. For this, quarantine centers are being built in community centers and panchayat buildings on a large scale, only after screening people will be allowed to go to their homes and stay in home quarantine for 14 days," he said.

Oraon said that providing employment to people after the lockdown was a major challenge for the Government. "After April 20, wide relaxation will be given in the farming sector. MNREGA schemes will also be started from April 20, for which necessary funds have been provided by Rural Development Minister Alamgir Alam. Exemption will also be given to work in the brick kiln," he added.

Title: 3 arrested for killing doctor in hit & run drive
Article:
The Delhi Police on Thursday arrested three persons in a case of hit-and-run in which a doctor was killed in south Delhi's Saket area two days ago.

Police said that the accused identified as Sandeep, Ajay and Vijay were on their way to Vasant Kunj to donate blood to a known patient when the accident happened.

Dr JP Yadav was posted at the MCD dispensary in Mehrauli and was returning home after work when a car allegedly crashed into his bicycle on the afternoon of April 13.

According to Atul Kumar Thakur, the Deputy Commissioner of Police (DCP), South district, on the basis of analysis of CCTV footage and local enquiries, the offending vehcile was identified to be a white colour car.

"Four vehicles of similar make and colour were identified, which were verified. The mark in one of these vehicles helped to identify the offending car," said the DCP.

"The offending vehcile was found to be registered in the name of one Sonu, a resident of Rohtak in Haryana. A team was sent to his house. Sonu told police he had given his car to his friend Vicky. On enquiry, Vicky disclosed that the car was being used by his friend Sandeep Pal Singh, a resident of east Delhi's Mandawali," said the DCP.

"During investigation, Sandeep told police that he along with his friend Ajay and Vijay went to Vasant Kunj by the car and, meanwhile, at Aurobindo Marg on Malviya Nagar traffic signal, one cyclist was hit by their vehicle and Vijay was the one who was driving the car," said the DCP adding that the offending vehicle has been seized and the three people have been arrested.

Title: Indore Police honours Corona Cop Kitchen Team with ‘Champion of Day’ title
Article:
Slightest form of appreciation and encouragement at the time of pandemic could generate loads of inspiration for frontline warriors fighting Coronavirus and which was witnessed after Indore Police honoured the Corona Cop Kitchen Team with the "Champion of the Day" title for their praiseworthy service which they have been doing from the day lockdown was imposed.

Police, administration, health and sanitation workers and staff have teamed and are working round the clock to defeat the global epidemic Corona.

At the same time, the Corona Warriors of the society are also providing food to the helpless and needy in this pandemic which is the need of the hour.

The Corona Cop Kitchen Team, run by the Citizen Cop Foundation of Indore, has been providing hygienic food to 3000 people daily with the help of the police for the last 20 days.

This team has so far presented the example of humanity by distributing more than 60000 food packets.

The Indore Police honored the Corona Cop Kitchen Team with the "Champion of the Day" title for this meritorious service.

The Indore police along with its duties is effectively discharging social responsibilities and distributing food packets to many needy people every day with the help of Corona Kitchen and various social organisations.

Like other social organisations, the IPS Association is also serving the people at the time of pandemic and through 1st battalion and 15th Battalion food packets are delivered to needy.

Title: Health news suggests relief on coronavirus front for Ujjain
Article:
The graph of Coronavirus in the district provided a much needed relief on Thursday which was revealed in the health bulletin released by Chief Medical and Health Officer claiming 64 tests were reported negative.In the report released by Chief Medical and Health Officer Thursday was a great relief for the people of Ujjain, as none of the reports received on Thursday came out positive, while all 64 reports received were negative.

The Chief Medical and Health Officer released health bulletin related to corona virus which states that the number of samples taken till April 16 is 1251. The report of 774 samples has been received, out of which 636 samples have tested negative. The number of reject samples is 112 and the number of positive samples by Thursday is 27. The number of positive reports of samples taken from Indore is 1. On Thursday, 3 people were tested positive in Ratlam district of the division increasing the number to 30, but the number of positive people in Ujjain is only 27, till Thursday the number of deaths caused due to Corona is 6. The total number of home quarantined persons is 2844.

The number of positive patients discharged on being healthy is 4. At the same time, 6 policemen have got the shaving done for rescue from Corona. Police personnel performing duty in Mahakal police station and Kotwali police station area have shaved their heads. Policemen say that corona infection affects through the hair and are shaving the heads at the police line.

ASI Chandrabhan Singh told that five policemen of Kotwali police station have shaved off their heads. Police personnel Avadhesh Singh posted at Mahakal police station shaved off his head which was done by his son.

Title: One day’s basic salary of officers, employees of State Govt will be deducted from April
Article:
In order to cooperate in the fight against COVID-19 pandemic in the state, one day’s basic salary of the officers and employees of the State Government will be deducted from the salary of April month (Payable in May).

The Director Budget has stated that it is expected to receive about Rs 100 crore in the Chief Minister's Relief Fund from this deduction at the request of the unions of the Government servants.It was informed that the deduction of those government servants will not be made from the salary of April,

who have voluntary contributed to the Chief Minister Relief Fund from the monthly salary of March through IFMIS.

If any Government servant wants to disagree with deduction of amount greater than or less than one day's basic salary or for any reason.

Title: Hero Electric #SmartMove through its ‘Switch to Electric’ campaign
Article:
While the whole country is amidst a major lockdown, Hero Electric, India’s biggest electric vehicle brand is urging people to make a #SmartMove through its ‘Switch to Electric’ campaign post-pandemic.

In its endeavor to make the country greener with ‘Zero Pollution’ transportation, the company foresees electric mobility as the right solution to maintain the positive momentum generated in the environment amidst the global crisis.

Hero Electric foresees a significant increase in number of vehicles on road after the lockdown lifts, linking to the fear of public transportation. The company anticipates a steep increase of around 20 million two-wheelers and 3 million four-wheelers after the lockdown, not just adding tonnes of greenhouse gases to the pollution level, but another expanded future crisis. India topped the charts of the worst polluted country as home to 5 of the 10 cities with the most hazardous air in 2019,

however as per a report by Greenpeace India, the pollution level came down by over 50 percent during the first 10 days of the lockdown imposed recently to combat COVID-19 outbreak.

Hero Electric is encouraging a ‘switch to electric mobility’ to maintain sustainable environment conditions to protect public health. Being at the forefront of the electrical two-wheeler industry, the company believes its vehicles will be a great support post Covid-19. As per a recent research by Harvard, long-term exposure to higher levels of fine particle pollution - PM2.5, were associated with higher rates of death caused by covid-19, the company added.

It added that Hero Electric will continue to innovate in this space and lead electric mobility in the country.

The company is doubling its capacity and is planning to take its current 600 touch-points to 800 by end of 2020 and make the brand accessible even in the most interior parts of the country.

Title: AISECT initiates online classes for students
Article:
As the lockdown has increased, students are quite worried about their studies. Keeping this in view, AISECT College of Professional Education has initiated online classes for students so that the students are not affected due to nationwide lockdown and corona virus.

In this, the faculty of the college is connecting with the students through digital platforms and the course is being completed through video lectures.It is important to note that the disaster of the corona virus is taking huge form in the whole world. Online classes have been started in all universities and other educational institutions of the AISECT group to ensure that students' studies in these situations are not affected. The time table of online classes has been released for the students, according to which online classes have started regularly. Apart from providing video lectures to students, notes are also being made available through WhatsApp and email.

In this way, classes of all faculties of the college have started, in which students are also giving a very good participation. Necessary training has also been made available to the faculty for online classes.

Regarding this new initiative of AISECT College of Professional Education, the college principal, Satyendra Khare, said that digital platform is being used to prevent students' learning in this time. For this, necessary training was given to faculty online.

Title: Miscreants target grocery shop, escape with grocery goods worth Rs 70,000
Article:
Miscreants targeted a grocery shop and escaped with grocery goods worth Rs 70,000 were burgled from a shop at Baghmughalia under Baghsewania police station area on Wednesday.

Police said that the victim Vijay Kumar found that lock of the door of his shop was broken and goods were found burgled.

A complaint was lodged with the Baghsewania police stating that he found on Wednesday that the lock was broken and door were open while the goods were found missing.

After the preliminary investigation, the police have registered a case under sections 457 and 380 of the IPC.

The victim claimed that he deals in grocery and after the lockdown his shop was closed. The grocery items worth over Rs 80000 were burgled. There was no cash in the shop at the time of the burglary. The shop is not installed with CCTV camera and footages of nearby installed CCTV cameras would be checked.

Meanwhile, grocery shop in Sarwadharam Colony was targeted and goods worth Rs 70,000 were burgled on Wednesday; Kolar police have started investigation.

The victim Sanjay Palaknia runs a grocery shop in Sarwadharam Colony which was burgled in the night on Wednesday.

The total loss in the burglary was Rs 70,000, claimed the victim.

In the burglary grocery goods were burgled by breaking the door of the shop.

On the complaint of the victim police have registered a case and suspects that habitual offenders of the area would be quizzed in the further investigation.

Title: 18-year-old youth, his sister attacked with sharp-edged weapon by 2 miscreants
Article:
Fuelled with old enmity an 18-year-old youth and his sister were attacked by two armed miscreants with sharp-edged weapons at Shiv Nagar under Piplani police station area late on Wednesday.

According to the police, the girl and her brother were was attacked by miscreants identified as Vishal and Babu with a sharp-edged weapon in which the girl sustained injuries in her hand in a bid to save her brother Shahrukh.

The injured victims were rushed to a nearby hospital and discharged after providing treatment. A complaint was lodged by Shahrukh stating that at around 3 in the afternoon he was standing outside his house when the two came and started a verbal spate which soon turned violent after they attacked victim with wooden sticks and when his sister spotted victim was beaten by the accused she came to his rescue but she was attacked by sharp edged weapon injuring her in her hand.

The locals rushed to their rescue and sensing danger accused escaped the spot and threatened them of life. The victim lodged a complaint with Piplani police and based on the complaint and after the preliminary investigation,

the police have registered a case under sections 294 and 324 of the IPC against Vishal and Babu who are residents of Lal Tanki area and are involved in assault and extorting money from the locals in the past.

Police said that crime record of the accused would be investigated. The miscreants were not found in night when few places were raided.

Title: Pot worth Rs 55L seized, three held
Article:
Crime Investigation Agency (CIA) Sikandarpur, of the Haryana police, arrested three persons including a Bangladesh national for alleged involvement in the smuggling of Cannabis (ganja), a contraband drug. The accused used to supply drugs in Delhi and adjoining areas besides Gurugram.

The police have seized 107 kg of cannabis is valued at Rs 55 lakh in the market.

The accused have been identified as Rajan Kumar (34) and Abhishek (19) of Bihar while the kingpin of the gang was Noor Islam alias Dada who is a Bangladesh national.

"The probe team had specific information about the criminals who were involved in smuggling contraband drugs. Following secret information the police team nabbed the criminals red-handed from Udyog Vihar area on Thursday and seized the contraband,” said Preet Pal Sangwan, ACP (crime).

A police official said the culprits reportedly smuggling the drug from Odisha and used to supply in the Delhi and National Capital Region (NCR) at a profit of Rs 5,000 to Rs 6,000 as per the demand.

“During the questioning, the culprit reveals that they were involved in cannabis smuggling for the last two months. Another gang member handed over the cannabis to sold in the city. The arrested accused didn’t have any criminal record,” Sagwan said.

Title: L-G engages with IRCS Delhi, reviews virus preparedness
Article:
Delhi Lieutenant Governor, Anil Baijal on Thursday reviewed preparedness of city's Indian Red Cross Society (IRCS) to assist in containment of Covid-19.

The meeting held through video conference, was also attended by Divisional Commissioner (Vice-Chairman, IRCS, Delhi), Dr N V Kamat, Honorary Secretary and other members of the managing nody.

At the outset, L-G directed Indian Red Cross Society, Delhi Branch to continue training and deploy social emergency response volunteers as second line of support to the State Health Department to assist them in containment of Covid-19. Kamat made a detailed presentation regarding various activities taken by IRCS, Delhi Branch to assist State Health Department in containment of Covid-19 outbreak.

"It was informed that 22 SERV Instructors (Social Emergency Response Volunteers) have been trained who have further trained volunteers in each district. Volunteers have already been deployed for Covid-19 containment activities district wise. Public awareness/IEC activities, distribution of pamphlets, masks, soap, etc. are being continuously done by Social Emergency Response Volunteers," said an official.

During the meeting the LG was apprised that IRCS, Delhi branch is distributing Food Packets to poor/destitute/homeless through its Community Kitchens of Raghubir Nagar (West), Sultanpuri (North-West), Rani Bagh (North-West), Mandawali (West) and Uttam Nagar. With the help of District Administration, IRCS, Delhi has provided 213875 food packets till 14th April.

LG further advised to ensure quantity and quality of food items and cleanliness/hygiene of Community Kitchen. He directed that social distancing must be maintained while distributing the Food Packets.

Title: 2 ambulance drivers held for ferrying 12 to Bihar for Rs 84K
Article:
Amid the countrywide lockdown due to Covid-19, the Gurugram Police on Thursday caught 12 people travelling in two ambulances that were headed for Bihar.

Police said that the ambulances, which had Uttar Pradesh numbers, were intercepted at Sohna Road on Thursday evening.

The accused also showed fake referral letters of the hospital in order to evade the police.

According to police, the drivers, identified as Satyam Singh of Uttar Pradesh and Brijesh of sector-12 in Gurugram and helpers were Shivam and Ashok who had picked twelve people from Gurugram’s Anjana colony.

"There was a deal that the drivers would pick these twelve people from Anjana colony in Gurugram and drop them to Bihar. The deal was fixed at Rs 7,000 for each passenger," said Preet Pal Sangwan, ACP (crime). When they reached Sohna Road, police checked the ambulance and found all of them inside it. “The drivers and the colleagues of the patients also showed the letterheads of the Vedic Hospital and the Hudson Hospital in Bihar. When the policemen suspected them, they called the numbers in the letterhead which were found to be fake. When the policemen strictly questioned the drivers, they made a complete disclosure stating the letter as fake,” Sangwan said.

The police registered a case against all under relevant sections of the IPC including the Disaster Management Act and started the investigation.

"After the lockdown, several reports came which stated that some people are using Ambulance for transporting vehicles across the border following which police have strengthened its vigil on bordering areas and continuous checking of Ambulances are going on," Sangwan said.

Title: Man arrested for killing brother-in-law
Article:
The Delhi Police has arrested a 24-year- old man along with his associate for allegedly killing his brother-in-law after extorting money from him on the pretext of getting him remarried.

Police said that the accused identified as Sandeep (24) had killed brother-in-law Om Prakash (55), a residentof Prem Nagar and a property dealer by profession. "After killing Prakash, Sandeep and his associate Saif Ali Khan (22) covered the body with a bed-sheet and placed it inside a car and drove the vehicle till the taxi stand in Sector-24, Rohini," police said.

According to S D Mishra, the Additional Commissioner of Police, Rohini, the body was recovered on April 11 after the Begumpur police station received a call about it.

"After analysing the call details on the phone number of the deceased, the suspects were traced and arrested. During interrogation, Sandeep disclosed that Prakash was his brother-in-law and his sister Reenu had died a year ago due to cancer," he said.

"Prakash had expressed his eagerness to marry again. Knowing that Prakash was wealthy, Sandeep demanded Rs 2 lakh and promised to solemnise his marriage with one of his friend's sister," said the Additional CP.

"Sandeep along with his associate decided to extort money from Prakash and called him to their rented accommodation in Karan Vihar area of Rohini. They took cash, jewellery and Prakash's two mobile phones and later killed him," said the Additional CP adding that Rs 2 lakh, mobiles phones and jewellery of the deceased has been recovered from the possession of the accused.

Title: Delhi, Maha discuss education reforms
Article:
nAt a time, when both Delhi and Maharashtra are battling out to deal with deadly coronavirus, Deputy Chief Minister and Education Minister of Delhi, Manish Sisodia, discussed the approach adopted by the Delhi Government in bringing out major reforms in the education system here in an online discussion with the Education Department of Maharashtra Government.

The live session, hosted by SCERT Maharashtra and Leadership for Equity (a research advisory organisation which aims to improve the education quality of Government schools in India) on Thursday, had Binay Bhushan, Director, Education and Shailendra Sharma, Advisor to Director, Education. From Government of Maharashtra, Dr. Vandana Krishna, Principal Secretary, School Education and Sports Department, Maharashtra State, Vaishali Veer, District Education Officer, Nasik and Mr Madhukar Banuri, Founder CEO, Leadership for Equity (LFE) participated.

Apart from this, around 700 participants joined the live session on Zoom, and more than 4,000 teachers watched it on Facebook.

Speaking at the session, Sisodia said, “If education officers and teachers are worried about education in these adverse times, then this is a positive thing. The idea behind this session is to open a platform for both the States to share their education models and associated ideas with each other. We have sent our teachers and principals to understand and learn from the best schools all over the country and abroad. And that is what we want to do, share our approach that we had adopted to bring about a change in the education system of Delhi and also get to learn from you about innovative practices taken up by government schools of Maharashtra.”

In response to a question from Dr Vandana, Principal Secretary Education, Govt of Maharashtra, Sisodia said, "Mindset is the key. Education does not only mean learning a new skill or cracking competitive examinations or securing good grades, it also means developing the right mindset. Delhi government focussed on transforming the education system for the need of society 20 years from now.”, added Education Minister of Delhi.

Explaining the model of Delhi Education reforrm, Shailendra Sharma, Prinicipal Advisor to Director Education said, "Delhi Education model is built has four pillars. These are- Revamping School Infrastructure, transforming teachers and Principals training and exposure, enhanced parental engagement and curricular reforms in key areas". Classrooms were revamped, labs and libraries were built, staffroom and toilets facilities created. Work in the area of Infrastructure is not merely a civil work, it goes a long way in building the faith of parents and teachers in the intent of the government.It raises the self esteem of students".

“Teachers and principals have been sent to Finland and Cambridge to learn about the education systems there. We also have tied up with the National Institute of Education, Singapore, and they designed a course on mentoring for us. The idea was not to adopt or copy what is being practised in other countries, the intent is to understand, learn and come back inspired,” added Sharma.

According to DoE officials, the Delhi Government has also worked on increasing Parental engagement by conducting mega PTMs three or four times a year. School Management Committees have been revamped and the government has ensured that they function smoothly by also providing them a budgetary allocation of Rs 5- 7 Lakhs each.

"Through Mission Buniyad, the focus was given on last child in the class by ensuring that they aquare foundational learning skills. The Happiness Curriculum was introduced to strengthen the emotional well being of our children. Children are exposed to stress from a very young age, and parents/teachers did not know how to deal with them. The Happiness curriculum addresses the well being of the students and focuses on their emotional development. All schools have implemented the curriculum in Delhi from grades, nursery to std 8. “ said Advisor to Director, Education, Sharma

Explaining the good initiatives taken by the education team of Maharashtra, Vishal Solanki said, “We have started with Mulyavardhan program which is a school based value education programme that we started some years ago. We inculcate constitutional values in the minds of our children through this programme.”

Title: Virus hits ‘cleanest’ Indore hard
Article:
With contribution of over 5 per cent to total number of Covid19 positive cases of the country comes as an intriguing example.

Till Thursday, the country has reported over 12,500 positive cases of Covid19 and 707 have been detected only from Indore including 37 deaths. These include 11 persons from other States who have been quarantined in a hotel and administration has added them into the list of positive cases.

The city in last few years has evoked awe and inspiration by emerging as the cleanest city of the country thrice in a row. A disciplined approach towards sanitation practices and self-restraint has won accolades for the city and its denizens from world over.

However, the image has been severely dented after the city contracted corona infection on large scale. The local have repeatedly breached the safety advisories issued by the district administration and on Wednesday, eight suspects kept at Rau quarantine centre under Rajendra Nagar police station had fled the facility.

Till late evening, the police managed to nab three of them while the search for remaining five of them is still on. All of them are said to be natives of Ranipura area who had reportedly slipped from the centre from the back side where a nullah is situated, an officer from Rajendra Nagar police said.

Earlier, a suspect of Tanzim Nagar area had fled the quarantine facility and reached his home. He was later tested positive and his family too had contracted infection after he had met them.

The locals had exhibited their unruly intent when people had ventured out on streets during the janta curfew announced by PM Narendra Modi on March 22. Though the administration later dealt them with police cases but such violations become a regular feature in Indore.

Suspects had misbehaved with doctors in the city and later locals had heckled health team which was carrying out health check in Ranipura area. On April 2, in a major incident, administration team including two women doctors were attacked with stones in Taat Patti Bakhal area under Kshtribagh police station and police later had arrested 13 culprits and booked four of them under National Security Act.

These four were sent to Jabalpur and Satna and later three of them had tested positive for covid19 under custody. Days ago a police constable and a member of Nagar Suraksha Samiti were attacked by locals in Chandan Nagar area as the two were trying to convince locals to retreat to their homes and not roam around in lockdown.

Till the time curfew was clamped in Indore, locals were coming out of homes in large numbers to buy vegetables in crowded mandis despite corona risk.

Title: Guv for wide publicity of AYUSH medicines
Article:
While reviewing the system of production and distribution of AYUSH drugs in the State, Governor Lalji Tandon said that there should be wide publicity about AYUSH medicines which protect from Corona virus and increase immunity in citizens.

He laid special emphasis on efforts for study and research for its treatment.

In the review, Production Manager of AYUSH drug manufacturers Vindhya Valley BS Pillai said that the production of Ayush medicine is being conducted effectively.

During this period of crisis, AYUSH medicines worth Rs 2.20 crore have been supplied. Presently there is storage of medicines worth Rs one crore.

He informed that the work of supply of medicines worth Rs 9 crore is being done by Vindhya Valley.In-charge Deputy Director AYUSH Dr Rajiv Mishra informed that AYUSH has distributed 78 lakh kits of immunity-enhancing drugs of Homeopathy,

Unani and Ayurveda from March 3 till now. Study and research of traditional medicines is being conducted by Pandit Khushilal Ayurved College under direction of Department of AYUSH of the Central Government. He informed that college is also studying results and effects of drug distribution work in rural areas.

He informed that posters and pamphlets of suggestions have been distributed by Department of AYUSH to increase immunity of Ayurveda, Homeopathy and Unani systems of medicine.

Title: NTA rejects fake news circulated on social media about (JEE) exam date
Article:
News of revised dates regarding Joint Enterance Examination (JEE) being circulated on social media has been declared 'fake' by National Testing Agency (NTA). The news says that NTA will conduct JEE Main in by first week.

However, NTA has issued an official notice calling the circulated news as fake.

It is to be noted that the JEE Main exam has been postponed due to COVID 19 outbreak across the world. Various sources have been circalating false news related to it.

In the official notice issued by NTA on its official website reads, "It has come to the notice of the National Testing Agency (NTA) that a fake Public Notice

dated 14 April 2020 has been circulating in social media regarding rescheduling of the JEE(Main) examination to the first week of July 2020. All candidates who are due to appear for JEE(Main) examination are hereby informed that there is no truth in the circulated fake Public Notice."

The notice also reads that the candidates are advised not to be misled by such false information and fake notices.

It has also been mentioned in the notice that the NTA will also take strict action by filing an FIR under relevant provisions of the IT Act and IPC against those unscrupulous elements who are creating and circulating such false information to mislead the candidates.

The candidates and their parents are also advised to only rely on the authentic information available on the official website of NTA jeemain.nta.nic.in and www.nta.ac.in for latest updates or call at 8287471852, 8178359845, 9650173668, 9599676953 and 8882356803 for any further clarification.

Title: 8 mediapersons booked for rioting, violating lockdown
Article:
Eight mediapersons have been booked on charge of rioting and violating the Epidemic Diseases Act for allegedly flouting the ongoing lockdown normsin Khammam district, police said on Thursday. The cases were registered on Wednesday following a complaint by a sub-jailor, the police said. The sub-jailor accused the reporters and others of forcibly entering the revenue guesthouse in Madhira town of the district on the night of April 13 where he, three other government officials, including a Tahsildar and a doctor, were sitting after dinner, and later attempted to assault him, they said. The mediapersons were also accused of not maintaining social distancing norms and coming into the guest house as a mob, police said. On April 14, the Tahsildar, Extension Officer of the Panchayat Raj and Rural Development, a government doctor and also the sub-jailor (who subsequently filed the complaint against the media persons) were booked under the Epidemic Diseases

Act for allegedly violating the ongoing lockdown norms and organising a liquor party at the guest house.

Title: CAIT protests against Maha, Odisha Govts’ decision
Article:
The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) on Thursday protested against the Maharashtra and Odisha Governments’ decision to allow delivery of all products through e-commerce firms like Amazon and Flipkart. The CAIT in a representation to the Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal complained that this move of the State Governments is sheer violation of MHA Guidelines which allow only delivery of essential commodities through e-commerce firms.

“In a communication sent to Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal today, the Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has highly objected to the notifications of Maharashtra & Odisha Government allowing e commerce Companies to trade into non-essential commodities also which is much against the guidelines of the Ministry of Home Affairs released on 15th April,2020. Such move of these Governments and preparedness of E commerce Companies to began their operations from 21st April,2020 for all kind of goods shall tantamount to create an uneven level playing field and will give rise to unnecessary conflicts. The CAIT has demanded that the Union Government immediately advise Government of Maharashtra & Odisha to withdraw the said notification being not in line with the guidelines of MHA,” said CAIT leaders BC Bhartia and Praveen Khandelwal.

Title: TN Govt bans preparation of gruel in mosques this Ramzan
Article:
Seeking to strictly implement lockdown rules during the holy month of Ramzan, the Tamil Nadu Government on Thursday said mosques in the state cannot prepare gruel from the rice allotted by it as is the case, but distribute it among the deserving Muslim benefeciaries.

Unlike the previous years, the gruel cannot be prepared in mosques owing to the lockdown rules imposed to stem the spread of coronavirus, even as places of religious worship have been shut as part of the country's fight against COVID- 19.

Late Chief Minister J Jayalalithaa had earlier announced providing rice to mosques free of cost for preparing the gruel consumed while breaking fast during Ramzan season.

Chief Secretary K Shanmugam chaired a meeting with respective Islamic clerics in this connection, an official release here said.

Title: Arunchal's lone Covid-19 patient tests negative again
Article:
The lone COVID-19 patient in Arunachal Pradesh has tested negative for the second time after his swab sample was sent to Regional Medical Research Centre (RMRC) at Dibrugarh in Assam within 24 hours on Wednesday, making the state free from any coronavirus case. Chief Minister Pema Khandu in a tweet stated that "the first positive #COVID 19 case of Arunachal Pradesh has tested negative (twice) after conducting 3rd and 4th test consecutively. The number of positive case in state is now zero."

The man from Medo village in Lohit district had tested positive on April 1 and 7 last after two tests conducted with decrease in viral load. However, his third test was done on April 14 when it was found negative, state Health Secretary P Prathiban said on Thursday. "As per protocol the sample was collected and sent for test within 24 hour and the result came out as a major relief to the state as he has recovered," Prathiban said.

Title: Modi speaks to Bhutanese PM, discusses situation arising out of COVID-19 pandemic
Article:
Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday spoke with his Bhutanese counterpart Lotay Tshering and discussed the situation arising out of the coronavirus pandemic.

"His Majesty The King (Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck) and Lyonchhen (the prime minister) are leading Bhutan''s efforts admirably," Modi tweeted.

He said India will stand by its close friend and neighbour in fighting the effects of the pandemic. Modi and Prime Minister Tshering discussed the regional situation in the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic and updated each other about the steps being taken by their governments to control its effects, an official statement later said.

Tshering thanked Modi for taking the lead to promote anti-COVID coordination at the regional level, even while fighting the pandemic within a large and complex country like India.

Title: Special trains for jawans on border duty amid lockdown
Article:
In order to maintain operational readiness on the borders even as the fight against coronavirus pandemic is on, two special trains will run on Friday and Saturday for the eastern and northern borders facing China and Pakistan respectively. Not willing to let its guard down at this juncture, the Army will approach the Ministry of railways for allocation of more special trains in the coming weeks.

Besides this, the Army has also issued fresh instruction to its personnel regarding restrictions and other measures to be followed after the lockdown was extended till May 3, officials said here on Thursday adding all military establishments, cantonments, formation headquarters and units will observe strict “No Movement” till April 19.

Giving details about the special trains, they said “Only personnel due to rejoin units deployed on the Northern and Eastern borders and have undergone the mandatory quarantine period and found medically fit will be accommodated.”

The train on Friday will run between Bengaluru - Belgaum- Secundrabad - Ambala- Jammu and the train on April 18 will run between Bengaluru - Belgaum- Secundrabad - Gopalpur - Howrah - New Jalpaiguri - Guwahati.

Sources said this will enable decongestion of Category A and B training establishments at Bengaluru, Belgaum, Secunderabad and Gopalpur as well as assist in operational preparedness of active formations deployed on the borders.

As regards new guidelines after extension of the lockdown, they said the two set of instructions are up to April 19 and from April 19 to May 3. As per the instructions, all military establishments, cantonments, formation headquarters and units will observe strict “No Movement” till April 19, sources said and only personnel connected with provision of essential services will be allowed to move.

In addition, within the Army headquarters only the Military Operations, Military Intelligence, operational logistics and strategic movement branches will function, to carry out operational and COVID-19 related tasks while keeping duration of stay and strength at bare minimum. All other branches have been asked to work from home till April 19 with any specific task to be handled on a case to case basis.

Similarly, in Command headquarters only manpower, logistics and operations branches will function with skeletal staff, the instructions said and at Northern and Eastern Commands the intelligence branch will also additionally function.

After April 19 till May 03, the instructions state that offices in Army, Command and formation headquarters may start functioning at 50% strength while the Directorate General Medical Services (Army), medical establishments and hospitals will continue functioning at full strength to provide a robust response to COVID-19.

However, as per instructions all training activities and temporary duties will remain suspended till May 03 as also social, sports, entertainment, academic, cultural and religious gatherings and regimental or ceremonial functions.

Sources added that any offices falling in ‘Hotspots or Containment Zones’ will observe strict “No Movement” till they are denotified and any exceptions to be given will be at the discretion of the local military authority.

Title: DRDO moves PPE testing facility from Gwalior to Delhi to overcome delays
Article:
In order to overcome the time delays and swift delivery of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) and masks, the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) has shifted its testing facility from Defence Research Development Establishment (DRDE), Gwalior, to the Institute of Nuclear Medicine & Allied Sciences (INMAS), Delhi. The INMAS is another premier Life Science Laboratory of DRDO.

The facility at INMAS is fully operational for testing and evaluation of body suits and masks. More than 10 batches of these items have already been tested at the laboratory.

The DRDE, Gwalior which has been at the forefront in fighting COVID-19, has now been tasked to confirm the label claims of masks and body suits received by HLL Lifecare Limited from foreign countries, before it is distributed to various agencies.

Moreover, as part of its continued fight against Covid-19, the public sector aviation conglomerate Hindustan Aeronautics Limited(HAL) has produced and handed over more than 300 aerosol boxes to various state governments like Karnataka, UP, Maharashtra, AP, Telangana and Kerala to be used in hospitals.

The transparent box acts as an insulator between the doctor and the patient. It can significantly reduce the possibility of Covid-19 transmission to doctors and medical staff treating Corona patients. “The results are encouraging and we can cater to more hospitals and states in this hour of need”, said R Madhavan, CMD, HAL. The boxes are produced at various divisions of HAL across the country.

In Uttar Pradesh, 30 Aerosol boxes produced by the Kanpur Division were handed over to Awanish Kumar Awasthi, ACS (Home) by Apurba Roy, GM, Transport Aircraft Division, Kanpur and Rakesh Mishra, Chief of Projects, Accessories Division, Lucknow in the presence of Amit Mohan Prasad (Principal Secretary, Health).

The HAL management has already announced contribution of Rs 26.25 crores in PM-CARES fund.

Title: ICSI-RVO to introduce 50 hrs online educational course on ‘Valuation of Securities’
Article:
The Covid-19 pandemic has brought in a paradigm shift in the process of learning and education.

Institute of Company Secretaries of India - Registered Valuers Organization (ICSI-RVO) is introducing 50 hours Online Educational Course on “Valuation of Securities or Financial Assets” from April 18 to 20 and from April 23 to 26.

The establishment of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Board of India (IBBI), changed the regulatory landscape in the country and ushered in the need of Registered Valuers to carry out valuation as required by the different Statutes and Authorities in India.

In furtherance to protecting and supporting its esteemed members, ICSI - RVO has proposed various other continuous educational programs and initiatives like invitation for development of research papers/case studies and development of MCQs on valuation related topics.

Top five research manuscripts will also be appropriately awarded with cash prizes. Members willing to register for the Educational Courses may fill-in the online application form at www.icsirvo.in with the required documents like Pan Card, Aadhaar Card, Membership and CoP/Experience Certificate (in case of employment). CS Ashish Garg, President ICSI, welcomed the efforts of ICSI- RVO and urged members to utilise this valuable time in upskilling themselves and enhancing their knowledge base.

Title: State mulls NDRF-type health disaster mgmt unit
Article:
In a bid to contain the Covid-19 outbreak, the State Government is planning to set up an NDRF-like health disaster management facility.

A proposal has been made to establish the NDRF-type Health Disaster Management Training Centre to impart training to doctors, paramedics, nurses and health workers to face any kind of health crisis that might take place in near future, said Health and Family Welfare Minister Naba Kishore Das following an inter-Ministerial meeting here on Thursday.

“We stressed on setting up an immunity research centre to carry out study on taking preventive measures against the disease. Also, we discussed a proposal on establishing an industry to manufacture medical equipment to improve healthcare system in the State,” Das said.

He said Odisha has achieved the target in testing 1,000 samples a day for detection of virus in

people.

“A few days ago, we were testing 100 samples. Now we are testing 1,000-1,200 samples, a sharp increase in testing capacity. We have decided to expand the capacity to 2,000-3,000 samples a day,” he said.

Speaking on enhancing the sample testing capacity in western Odisha, he said that only one machine has been installed at VIMSAR in Burla to test COVID-19 samples. He has urged the NIT Director to instal two more testing machines so that 100 samples can be tested a day at the medical institution.

He sought permission from the Centre for sample testing in all the medical colleges across the State

Informing about a proposal for mass sample testing, he said, “We hope to implement a pool test for COVID-19 allowing expansion of the current screening capacity and detection of virus in the community.”

Title: Govt to share info on corona steps with people
Article:
A day after senior bureaucrats were appointed to contain COVID-19 in six hotspots in Bhubaneswar, the State Government on Thursday decided to share “vital information” including test results of suspected cases and steps being taken to tackle the crisis with the residents.

Notably, out of the 60 COVID-19 cases in the State so far, as many as 46 have been reported from the capital city.

Chief Secretary Asit Tripathy, in an order on Thursday, asked officials to use loudspeakers and create area-wise WhatsApp groups to disseminate information and communicate with local people in the six containment zones, Surya Nagar, Bomikhal, Satya Nagar, Sundarpada and Kapila Prasad.

Tripathy also asked them to contact cable channels for carrying out awareness drives in the clusters.

“The decision to disseminate information in the containment zones was taken after we found out that people were in the dark over all that is happening around them. Also, loudspeakers should be used to update information about availability of essential items,” the Chief Secretary said.

All containment zones have been barricaded, prohibiting entry and exit of persons, he said.

Once the area is sealed, teams of Andanwadi Workers, auxiliary nurse midwives and other health workers, under the guidance of community medicine and epidemiology experts, would move from one house to another to check on people. Samples of those found exhibiting flu-like symptoms would be collected at random and sent for examination to rule out chances of local transmission, he said.

Maintaining that supply of essential commodities and medicines at doorsteps remains one of the biggest challenges faced by the officials in the containment zones, Tripathy asked the Municipal Commissioner to take possible steps to ensure that people are not inconvenienced.

“People with disabilities, those living alone, pregnant women and aged persons should be given priority in these clusters,” he asserted.

If no new case is detected after conducting at least two rounds of survey, the Municipal Commissioner or the Collector might ease restrictions in these areas in consultation with the Health Department, Tripathy said.

Meanwhile, the Sundargarh district administration on Thursday tagged Bisra town as a containment zone and enforced necessary restrictions there for 48 hours till 11.30 am on April 18.

Several other districts, including Puri, Ganjam, Jajpur and Kendrapada, have also identified containment zones and sealed them in accordance with the Government’s directive.

Title: Centre extends ceasefire pact with Naga group
Article:
The Centre on Thursday extended the ceasefire agreement with the National Socialist Council of Nagaland-K (Khongo) for six months instead of a year, in the wake of the COVID-19 outbreak, according to official statement issued here.

The ceasefire agreement was "extended with effect from April 16 to October 17, 2020, to bring about lasting peace in the state of Nagaland with the involvement of the Naga people", the statement issued by the Office of the Chairman of the Cease Fire Supervisory Board (CSFB), Ministry of Home Affairs, said.

A ceasefire agreement was signed between the Government of India and the NSCN-K (Khongo) on April 15 last year in New Delhi, but this time the decision to extend it has been taken in Kohima in view of the coronavirus pandemic, it said.

It, however, said the ceasefire will be subject to adherence to the ceasefire ground rules mutually agreed and signed by the two sides.

Giving effect to the extension of the ceasefire agreement, Ceasefire Monitoring Group chairman Lt Gen Shokin Chauhan appended the statement on behalf of the Centre while NSCN-K (Khongo) CFSB supervisor Shellen Konyak and secretary Kaino Chishi signed for the group.

Title: First time in 167 years, railways not ferrying passengers on its birthday
Article:
The Indian Railways turned 167 years old on Thursday and for the first time ever, its trains did not carry any passengers on its birthday and instead stood idle in the yards waiting for the nationwide lockdown to end.

On this day 167 years ago, the wheels of the first passenger train in the country from Mumbai to Thane started rolling.

In 1974, Indians experienced life without trains for the first time. In May 1974 during the strike of the railways that lasted for around three weeks, drivers, station masters, guards, track staff and many others went on 'chakka jam' demanding fixed working hours for train drivers and an across-the-board pay hike.

"I can recall those times vividly. I remember that our leader George Fernandes had almost secured a deal with the then railway minister, but it fell through when it was taken to the then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi," All India Railwaymens Federation General Secretary Shiv Gopal Mishra, who was an apprentice in the railways at that time, told PTI.

"Fernandes was arrested in Lucknow. The workers went through a lot at that time. But those were days that angry workers had refused to give in and took great risks to get their demands met," he said.

However, just like this time, four decades ago too freight trains carrying essential supplies were run and the unions agreed to let some passenger trains run on the trunk routes like the Kalka Mail from Howrah to Delhi.

"Never ever in its history, there has been such a long interruption of services. Not during the World Wars, not during the 1974 railway strike, or any other national calamity or natural disaster," a railway spokesperson said.

The first Indian Railways passenger train was flagged off on April 16, 1853, from Mumbai to nearby Thane.

On Thursday, the Railway Ministry wished the railways a happy birthday on Twitter - "Today, 167 years ago with the zeal of 'never to stop' the wheels of the first passenger train from Mumbai to Thane started rolling. For the first time, passenger services are stopped for your safety. Stay indoors & make the nation victorious," it said. Railway has suspended all passenger services since March 25 till May 3 due to the coronavirus outbreak. Around 15,523 trains run by the railways have been affected including 9,000 passenger trains and 3,000 mail express services which are run daily. It caters to over 20 million passengers every day.

Title: Two Covid-19 positive scribes booked in HP
Article:
Himachal Pradesh Police has booked two Covid-19 patients, both journalists, for unauthorised entry into the State from neighbouring Punjab. Director General of Police (DGP) S.R. Mardi said on Thursday that the duo, who worked in a Hindi newspaper in Jalandhar, had entered the state illegally in a truck transporting vegetables on April 10.

They tested positive for Covid-19 on Wednesday.

First Information Reports (FIRs) have been registered against both the men for violating the ongoing curfew and the truck drivers have also been booked, the DGP added.

Issuing a warning to drivers engaged in supply of essential commodities or cargoes, the DGP said any driver found to be ferrying unauthorised persons from other states to HP would be dealt sternly as per law.

Title: Money laundering case against Tablighi chief
Article:
The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Thursday registered a money laundering case against the chief of Delhi-based Tablighi Jamaat Markaz, Maulana Saad, and others, days after the Delhi Police booked the Maulana under sections of the Epidemic Disease Act.

The ED registered the Enforcement Case Information Report (ECIR) against Saad under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) based on the FIR registered by Delhi Police on March 31.
